1.text: Weight shifts are a great beginner balance exercise.

2.text: Walking sideways using controlled movements can help with your balance.

3.text: Grapevine walking is similar to sideways walking, but it's a bit more challenging.

4.text: There’s a reason this exercise is used for field sobriety tests.

5.text: Standing on 1 leg is an easy way to improve your balance, and you can do it anywhere!

6.text: Dumbbells can make standing on one leg more challenging (and effective).

7.text: Building your glutes, quads, and hamstrings can help with your balance.

8.text: Using the wobble board at your gym is a great way to work on your balance.

10.text: Dancing is a fun way to improve your balance and get in a great workout.

11.text: Doing balance exercises consistently is the best way to see results.

12.text: Being tired can actually worsen your balance.
